fields.name: Transparency
fields.description: Rebuilt the firm's primary internal analytical tool into a more interactive/dynamical tool using a React-Redux front-end consuming an API built using Django REST Framework.
fields.showcase_description: Rebuilt the firm's primary internal analytical tool into a more interactive/dynamical tool using a React-Redux front-end consuming an API built using Django REST Framework.

fields.name: Asset Visualizations
fields.description: Created a custom, flexible and proprietry charting package using D3.js that the firm now uses in a variety of applications to visualize data in more than 2 dimensions and animate the visualization over time.
fields.showcase_description: Created a custom, flexible and proprietry charting package using D3.js that the firm now uses in a variety of applications to visualize data in more than 2 dimensions and animate the visualization over time.

fields.name: Rock Creek Insights
fields.description: Constructed an application, Rock Creek Insights, using MeteorJS that the firm uses to provide client risk reporting, monitor risk and compare performances of managed pension funds.

fields.name: Risk Monitoring Application
fields.description: Developed a Django application that used Bloomberg's API to monitor specific regulatory risk guidelines, replacing expensive State Street software and saving the firm upwards of seventy thousand dollars per year.

fields.name: P2P Lending Application
fields.description: Developed internal Python applications using Flask that interfaced with P2P lending systems (Lending Club, Funding Circle, etc.) to allow the firm to manage, monitor and execute investments in real time.

fields.name: Accounts API
fields.description: During my tenure at The Atlantic, we spent a year overhauling our entire revenue/subscription model.  Part of this involved separating out the functionality that handled accounts and subscriptions into a separate service.  I was part of a small team that rebuilt the entire account/subscription management system as a decoupled REST API using Django REST Framework.  The backend of the API had to interact with several different data sources and maintain a source of truth, while not being able to store most of the data directly.

fields.name: Apple News
fields.description:
During my tenure at The Atlantic, I created the entire Apple News syndication platform.  This platform was responsible for algorithmically parsing article content in HTML and converting it to Apple News Format, a JSON document that defines the components of the article for 
 Apple to render.  Additionally, the platform was responsible for managing the publication of articles via Apple News' API.

fields.name: Algorithmic Trading in Futures Market - Neural Networks Approach
fields.description: Designed, implemented and tested a Neural Network based algorithmic trading strategy for trading agricultural and metal commodities futures. Achieved a Sharpe Ratio of 1.46 and returns of 21% over a 4-month trading window between January 1, 2016, and May 1, 2016.

fields.name: Machine Learning in Fantasy Sports
fields.description:
I used third-party APIs and data scraping to assemble a massive dataset of NHL statistics to show the statistical possibility of predicting over and undervaluations for individual players in a given game.  These predictions were made based on both a situational model and a cyclical time series model.

The situational model captured performance based on situational criteria and how that player historically performed based on that criteria.  This included things like whether or not the game was home or away, who the opponent was and where the player's team stood in the league standings.  The cyclical time series model captured the "streakiness" of the player, using recent performances and how that player historically played conditioned on their recent performance.

These models used combinations of Gaussian Mixture Models, Random Forest Classification algorithms and multivariate regression schemes to cluster players based on predicted point distributions and determine whether or not a player was over or undervalued for the subsequent game.  In head to head matchups, backtesting showed that the model was capable of providing roughly a 17% edge over the naive 50% win rate.

fields.name: WInd Turbine Calculator
fields.description: My responsibilities for the creating of a wind turbine energy and economic analysis tool for the Power and Water division of General Electric included the functionality programming of the economic analysis of wind turbine plants based on individual wind turbine parameters, mechanical considerations, climate considerations and locational considerations. Eventually, the team was able to create a web-based Wind Turbine calculator prototype in Python that allowed GE to compare the costs and energy production of various wind turbine designs based on numerous wind turbine design parameters and wind turbine location.

fields.name: 3 Link Parallel Planar Robot Manipulator
fields.description: Designed, constructed and programmed a planar robot consisting of three separate 2-link arms controlling the desired and manipulated position of a target platform on a planar surface
